Simple Homemade Cranberry Sauce

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the delightful world of homemade cranberry sauce! This simple yet flavorful recipe is perfect for enhancing your holiday meals or simply enjoying as a vibrant side dish. Made with just three wholesome ingredients—fresh cranberries, granulated sugar, and water—this cranberry sauce is not only easy to prepare but also incredibly refreshing. Whether you serve it alongside turkey for Thanksgiving or pair it with your favorite cheeses, this recipe guarantees a burst of tangy sweetness in every bite. Our step-by-step guide will walk you through the process of creating a cranberry sauce that is not only delicious but also a beautiful addition to any table. So, let’s dive into the rich flavors of this classic condiment and elevate your meals with this homemade touch!

Ingredients

fresh cranberries

Choose bright, plump cranberries without blemishes or soft spots. If you can’t find fresh cranberries, you can use frozen ones; just make sure to rinse and drain them before cooking. For a twist, consider mixing in some chopped apples or orange zest for added flavor.

granulated sugar

Adjust the amount of sugar based on your taste preference; you can reduce it if you prefer a less sweet sauce. For a different flavor profile, try using brown sugar or honey instead of granulated sugar. Keep in mind that using honey will alter the texture slightly.

water

Use filtered water for the best taste, especially if your tap water has a strong flavor. If you want to enhance the flavor of the sauce, consider replacing some of the water with orange juice or apple cider for a fruity twist.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Cranberries

    Begin by rinsing 12 ounces of fresh cranberries under cold water. Inspect the cranberries for any stems or bad berries, discarding those that are soft, shriveled, or otherwise undesirable.

  • Step 2: Combine Ingredients

    In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed cranberries, 1 cup of granulated sugar, and 1 cup of water. Stir gently to combine all ingredients.

  • Step 3: Boil the Mixture

    Place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Stir occasionally to help dissolve the sugar completely.

  • Step 4: Simmer the Sauce

    Once the mixture reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low to let it simmer. Allow it to cook for about 10 minutes. You will notice the cranberries start to burst and the sauce will begin to thicken.

  • Step 5: Cool the Sauce

    After simmering, remove the saucepan from heat and let the cranberry sauce cool. Keep in mind that the sauce will thicken even more as it cools.

  • Step 6: Serve or Refrigerate

    Transfer the cooled cranberry sauce to a serving bowl. If not serving immediately, cover and refrigerate until you are ready to serve.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly rinse fresh cranberries?

Place the cranberries in a colander and run them under cold water. Gently shake to remove any dirt or debris. Inspect the berries and remove any that are soft or discolored.

What can I use instead of granulated sugar?

You can use brown sugar for a deeper flavor or honey/maple syrup for a natural sweetener, but be mindful that this may alter the cooking time slightly.

How do I know when the cranberries are done cooking?

The cranberries will burst and soften after about 10 minutes of simmering. The sauce should thicken and have a slightly syrupy consistency.

What should I do if my cranberry sauce is too runny?

If your sauce is too runny, simmer it a little longer over low heat to reduce it further. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

How can I safely handle hot pans during cooking?

Always use oven mitts or pot holders when handling hot pans. Avoid reaching over the pot and ensure your workspace is clear to prevent spills.

Can I make cranberry sauce ahead of time?

Yes! Cranberry sauce can be made 1-2 days in advance. Store it in the refrigerator in an airtight container until you're ready to serve.

What is the best way to store leftover cranberry sauce?

Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator. It should last for about a week, or you can freeze it for up to 2 months.

What are some variations I can try with this basic recipe?

You can add orange zest, cinnamon, or chopped nuts for extra flavor and texture. Experiment with spices to find your favorite combination!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This cranberry sauce is naturally gluten-free and vegan, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For those looking to reduce sugar intake, consider substituting the granulated sugar with a natural sweetener like maple syrup or agave nectar. Ensure that the sweetener is adjusted to taste, as different sweeteners have varying levels of sweetness.

Pairings

This homemade cranberry sauce pairs beautifully with roasted turkey or chicken, as its tartness cuts through the richness of the meat. For a vegetarian option, serve it alongside a nut roast or stuffed acorn squash. It also complements creamy cheeses like Brie or goat cheese, making it a perfect addition to cheese boards. For beverages, consider a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied red like Pinot Noir, both of which enhance the sauce's bright flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the cranberry sauce chilled or at room temperature in a decorative bowl. Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary or thyme for a touch of elegance. For a festive presentation, consider pairing it with a platter of Thanksgiving favorites—such as stuffing, mashed potatoes, and green beans—for a vibrant centerpiece. Spoon a small amount over desserts like cheesecake or ice cream for a delightful contrast of flavors.
